title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: The '''aftermath of the 2021 storming of the United States Capitol'' prompted criminal investigations, public health concerns, and various political reprocusions.

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: The storming of the United States Capitol was a [[riot]] and violent attack against the [[117th United States Congress]] on January 6, 2021, carried out by a mob of supporters of [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Donald Trump|Donald]] Trumping an [[Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election|attempt to overturn his defeat]]  in the [[2020 United States presidential election|2020 presidential election]].<ref name="2021-01-11-ap-sinister">{{cite web|date=January 11, 2021|title=Capitol assault a more sinister attack than first appeared|url=https://apnews.com/article/14c73ee280c256ab4ec193ac0f49ad54|access-date=January 12, 2021|quote=Under battle flags bearing Donald Trump's name, the Capitol's attackers pinned a bloodied police officer in a doorway, his twisted face and screams captured on video. They mortally wounded another officer with a blunt weapon and body-slammed a third over a railing into the crowd. 'Hang Mike Pence!' the insurrectionists chanted as they pressed inside, beating police with pipes. They demanded House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's whereabouts, too. They hunted any and all lawmakers: 'Where are they?' Outside, makeshift gallows stood, complete with sturdy wooden steps and the noose. Guns and pipe bombs had been stashed in the vicinity. ... The mob got stirring encouragement from Trump and more explicit marching orders from the president’s men. 'Fight like hell,' Trump exhorted his partisans at the staging rally. 'Let's have trial by combat,' implored his lawyer, Rudy Giuliani, whose attempt to throw out election results in trial by courtroom failed. It's time to 'start taking down names and kicking ass,' said Republican Rep. Mo Brooks of Alabama. Criminals pardoned by Trump, among them Roger Stone and Michael Flynn, came forward at rallies on the eve of the attack to tell the crowds they were fighting a battle between good and evil.|agency=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref> After attending a pro-Trump rally, thousands<ref>Steve Doig, [https://theconversation.com/it-is-difficult-if-not-impossible-to-estimate-the-size-of-the-crowd-that-stormed-capitol-hill-152889 "It is difficult, if not impossible, to estimate the size of the crowd"], ''The Conversation'', January 8, 2021.</ref>of his supporters marched down [[Pennsylvania Avenue]] to the [[United States Capitol|Capitol]], and many stormed the building in an effort to disrupt the [[2021 United States Electoral College count|Electoral College vote count]] by a [[Joint session of the United States Congress|joint session of Congress]], and prevent the formalization of [[President-elect of the United States|President-elect]][[Joe Biden]]'s election victory.<ref name="wp-ldhd-hamstrung">{{cite news|last1=Leonnig|first1=Carol D.|last2=Davis|first2=Aaron C.|last3=Hermann|first3=Peter|last4=Demirjian|first4=Karoun|date=January 10, 2021|title=Outgoing Capitol Police chief: House, Senate security officials hamstrung efforts to call in National Guard|work=[[The Washington Post]]|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/sund-riot-national-guard/2021/01/10/fc2ce7d4-5384-11eb-a817-e5e7f8a406d6_story.html|access-date=January 11, 2021}}</ref><ref name="BarrettEtAl">{{Cite web|last1=Barrett|first1=Ted|last2=Raju|first2=Manu|last3=Nickeas|first3=Peter|title=Pro-Trump mob storms US Capitol as armed standoff takes place outside House chamber|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/06/politics/us-capitol-lockdown/index.html|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210106211203/https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/06/politics/us-capitol-lockdown/index.html|archive-date=January 6, 2021|access-date=January 6, 2021|website=CNN}}</ref>Breaching police perimeters, rioters then [[Occupation (protest)|occupied]], [[Vandalism|vandalized]],<ref>{{cite news|date=January 7, 2021|title=Trump supporters storm Capitol; DC National Guard activated; woman fatally shot|work=The Washington Post|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2021/01/06/dc-protests-trump-rally-live-updates/}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=Pallini|first=Thomas|date=January 7, 2021|title=Photos show the aftermath of an unprecedented and destructive siege on the US Capitol that left 4 rioters dead|work=Business Insider|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/photos-show-the-aftermath-of-a-siege-on-capitol-building-2021-1?IR=T}}</ref>and [[Looting|looted]]<ref>{{Cite news|last1=Daly|first1=Matthew|last2=Balsamo|first2=Michael|date=January 8, 2021|title=Deadly siege focuses attention on Capitol Police|agency=Associated Press|url=https://apnews.com/article/capitol-police-death-brian-sicknick-46933a828d7b12de7e3d5620a8a04583|access-date=January 9, 2021}}</ref>parts of the building for several hours.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Landale|first1=James|date=January 7, 2021|title=Capitol siege: Trump's words 'directly led' to violence, Patel says|work=BBC News|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-55571482|url-status=live|access-date=January 7, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210108020736/https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-politics-55571482|archive-date=January 8, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Dozier|first1=Kimberly|last2=Bergengruen|first2=Vera|date=January 6, 2021|title=Incited by the President, Trump Supporters Violently Storm the Capitol|url=https://time.com/5926883/trump-supporters-storm-capitol/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210108020624/https://time.com/5926883/trump-supporters-storm-capitol/|archive-date=January 8, 2021|access-date=January 7, 2021|work=Time}}</ref><ref name="trump told">{{cite web|title=This is what Trump told supporters before many stormed Capitol Hill.|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/trump-told-supporters-stormed-capitol-hill/story?id=75110558|url-access=registration|access-date=January 10, 2021|publisher=ABC News|quote=We have come to demand that Congress do the right thing and only count the electors who have been lawfully slated. Lawfully slated. I know that everyone here will soon be marching over to the Capitol building to peacefully and patriotically make your voices heard. Today, we will see whether Republicans stand strong for integrity of our elections. But whether or not they stand strong for our country, our country. Our country has been under siege for a long time. Far longer than this four year period.}}</ref>The assault<ref>MacCharles Tonda; Toronto Star: "Two days after rioters stormed the U.S. Capitol, Trudeau blames Trump fpr 'an assault on democracy'" 2021 January 8 [https://www.thestar.com/politics/federal/2021/01/08/two-days-after-rioters-stormed-the-us-capitol-trudeau-blames-trump-for-an-assault-on-democracy.html] Retrieved January 12, 2021.</ref>led to the evacuation and lockdown of the Capitol, as well as five deaths.<ref>{{Cite web|title=Capitol Riot Death Toll Rises to 5; Police Hunt for Suspects|url=https://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/capitol-riot-death-toll-rises-to-5-police-hunt-for-suspects/2534406/|access-date=January 12, 2021|website=NBC4 Washington}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|date=January 8, 2021|title=Capitol attack: the five people who died|url=http://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/jan/08/capitol-attack-police-officer-five-deaths|access-date=January 12, 2021|website=The Guardian}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: === AirBnB cancellations ===

[[AirBnB]] cancelled all reservations in Washington, D.C. for the week of January 20, and deactivated accounts of users who it discovered belong to hate groups or participated in the storming of the Capitol.<ref name="airbnb_tightened>[https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/airbnb-reservations-cancelled-inaugruation/2021/01/13/2205e42a-55b9-11eb-a931-5b162d0d033d_story.html Airbnb to cancel all D.C. reservations during inauguration week as security in the city is tightened]</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack

Reservations During Inauguration |date=13 Jan 2021}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: Adam Newbold, a retired Navy SEAL and the director of firearms training business ATG Worldwide, posted a Facebook video on January 6 in which he described “breaching the Capitol.” He was questioned by the FBI. On January 12, the ATG Facebook page shared a video message from Newbold in which he described having participated in a "caravan" to the Capitol on January 6 because he was “angry at the direction of our country."<ref>{{Cite web|last=Walker|first=Hunter|date=13 January 2021|title=Some House Democrats Have ‘Real Concern’ GOP Colleagues May Have Aided Capitol Attack|url=https://www.huffpost.com/entry/house-democrats-concern-republicans-riot-capitol_n_5fffa4dec5b6c77d85ecbc9f|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=14 January 2021|website=HuffPost|language=en}}</ref> Newbold has expressed regret for his participation and said he is cooperating with the FBI.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Ross|first=Jamie|date=13 January 2021|title='I am not a terrorist': Retired Navy SEAL speaks after Capitol siege|url=https://abcnews.go.com/US/video-shows-retired-navy-seal-boasting-breaching-capitol/story?id=75206495|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2021-01-14|website=ABC News|language=en}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
deleted: A man from Western NY named Pete Harding was arrested for his role in the Capitol building riotsl. <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.lmtonline.com/news/article/Western-NY-man-arrested-after-attending-riot-at-15869242.php |title=Archived copy |access-date=January 14, 2021 |archive-date=January 14, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210114192514/https://www.lmtonline.com/news/article/Western-NY-man-arrested-after-attending-riot-at-15869242.php |url-status=live }}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: As of January 13, over 50 public sector employees and elected officials and over a dozen Capitol police officers were facing internal investigations to determine their possible complicity in the riot.<ref>{{Cite web|last=So|first=Linda|last2=Januta|first2=Andrea|last3=Berens|first3=Mike|date=13 January 2021|title=Off-duty cops, other officials face reckoning after rallying for Trump in D.C|url=https://news.yahoo.com/off-duty-cops-other-officials-214902576.html|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=14 January 2021|website=news.yahoo.com|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: In a January 14 court filing, federal prosecutors sought to keep Jacob Anthony Chansley in detention, alleging that his participation in the riot was part of a failed plot "to capture and assassinate elected officials." While rioting inside the Capitol, Chansley wore a headdress and face paint and held a six-foot spear, and he spoke on a bullhorn.<ref>{{Cite web|last=CNN|first=Katelyn Polantz|title=US says Capitol rioters intended to 'capture and assassinate' elected officials|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/15/politics/capitol-capture-assassinate-elected-officials/index.html|access-date=2021-01-15|website=CNN}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: === Other ===

On January{{nbsp}}11, the [[New York State Bar Association]] (NYSBA) announced that it has launched an inquiry into Giuliani for his role in the uprising, which could subject him to expulsion from the association and recommendation for disbarment if he is held liable.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-11/giuliani-may-be-expelled-from-n-y-bar-group-over-capitol-riot|work=Bloomberg|date=January 11, 2021|access-date=January 11, 2021|title=Giuliani May Be Expelled by New York Bar Group Over Capitol Riot|first=Erik|last=Larson}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: === Investigation by involved individuals workplaces ===

Multiple individuals involved in the riot were investigated by their workplaces with some being fired for their participation, as some businesses were identified by social media users who called for negative reviews and comments to be posted or the establishments to be boycotted. Most businesses who have done so are private businesses as those who work for the government and unionized workers hold more protections from firing.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Pisani|first=Joseph|last2=Bussewitz|first2=Cathy|date=January 8, 2021|title=Rioters Who Stormed US Capitol Now Face Backlash at Work|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/business/articles/2021-01-08/rioters-fired-face-company-boycotts-after-storming-capitol|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=January 15, 2021|website=US News}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Keenan|first=Alexis|date=January 9, 2021|title=Here are the rights employers have to fire workers identified as Capitol Hill rioters|url=https://www.yahoo.com/now/employers-rights-fire-capitol-hill-trump-supporters-123151656.html|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2021-01-15|website=www.yahoo.com|language=en-US}}</ref> The earliest report of participants being fired was a Maryland man identified in several highly publicized pictures, wearing his work ID badge and fired from his position the next day.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Walsh|first=Joe|date=January 7, 2021|title=Man In Capitol Mob Fired After Wearing His Company ID Badge To Riot|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/joewalsh/2021/01/07/man-in-capitol-mob-fired-after-wearing-his-company-id-badge-to-riot/|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2021-01-15|website=Forbes|language=en}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: In the three days following the riot, the police departments of [[San Antonio Police Department|San Antonio, Texas]]; [[Zelienople, Pennsylvania]]; [[Seattle Police Department|Seattle, Washington]]; and [[Troy, New Hampshire]] all suspended officers or placed them under internal review for their involvement in the invasion of the Capitol or the preceding events.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/09/us/politics/capitol-police.html|title=Police officers who traveled to Washington are being investigated for connection to the Capitol melee|date=January 9, 2021|accessdate=January 15, 2021|work=[[The New York Times]]|first=Neil|last=MacFarquhar}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi touched upon the investigations in a speech on January 15, stating; "If, in fact, it is found that members of Congress were accomplices to this insurrection, if they aided and abetted the crime, there may have to be actions taken beyond Congress in terms of prosecution for that."<ref>{{Cite web|last=Seddiq|first=Oma|date=January 15, 2021|title=Pelosi says Congress members may face prosecution if an investigation shows they were accomplices in Capitol siege|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/pelosi-congress-members-may-face-prosecution-if-they-aided-riots-2021-1|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2021-01-15|website=Business Insider}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
deleted: A 26-year-old Utah man who is a "crowdfunded video journalist" and activist previously charged for alleged criminal activity at a 2020 [[Black Lives Matter]] protest recorded widely-seen video of a police officer shooting Ashli Babbitt inside the Capitol. He told ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' on January{{nbsp}}13 about his presence in the Capitol and proclaimed that he "[hadn't] done anything incriminating. If they were after me, I'd already have been arrested." The next day, he was arrested by the FBI and charged with entering a restricted building, disorderly conduct on Capitol grounds, and interfering with law enforcement; the FBI's affidavit noted that "he has admitted that he has no press credentials and the investigation has not revealed any connection between [the man] and any journalistic organizations".<ref name="rs-dickinson-interview">{{cite web |last1=Dickinson |first1=Tim |title='I Don't Think She Deserved to Die': Black Activist Who Filmed Ashli Babbitt Shooting Speaks Out |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-features/ashli-babbitt-shooting-video-jayden-x-maga-riot-interview-1112949/ |publisher=Rolling Stone |access-date=15 January 2021 |date=January 13, 2021}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: A man arrested on January 6 and charged with "enter the United States Capitol Grounds against the will of the United States Capitol Police" shot and killed himself at his home in [[Alpharetta, Georgia]].<ref>[https://www.crimeonline.com/2021/01/13/georgia-man-arrested-at-u-s-capitol-riot-shot-himself-in-the-chest-faced-only-brief-jail-time-or-modest-fine/]</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: A man arrested on January 6 and charged with "enter the United States Capitol Grounds against the will of the United States Capitol Police" shot and killed himself at his home in [[Alpharetta, Georgia]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.crimeonline.com/2021/01/13/georgia-man-arrested-at-u-s-capitol-riot-shot-himself-in-the-chest-faced-only-brief-jail-time-or-modest-fine/|title=Georgia man arrested at U.S. Capitol died of suicide two days later; faced only brief jail time or modest fine|date=January 13, 2021|website=Crime Online}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: A U.S. Capitol Police officer who was on duty at the Capitol during the event committed suicide.<ref>[https://nypost.com/2021/01/10/veteran-capitol-cop-reportedly-commits-suicide-days-after-dc-riot/  Veteran Capitol cop reportedly commits suicide days after DC riot], ''New York Post'', Aaron Feis, January 10, 2021</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
deleted: A U.S. Capitol Police officer who was on duty at the Capitol during the event committed suicide.<ref>[https://nypost.com/2021/01/10/veteran-capitol-cop-reportedly-commits-suicide-days-after-dc-riot/  Veteran Capitol cop reportedly commits suicide days after DC riot], ''New York Post'', Aaron Feis, January 10, 2021</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: == Far-Right Extremist Backlash ==
=== Portrayal of Ashli Babbitt as Martyr ===

According the the [[Anti-Defamation League|ADL]], Babbitt’s likeness has been used to create images, posts and other content celebrating right-wing extremist ideologies, including a flag commemorating the Capitol insurgency. White supremacists see Babbitt as a symbol of white resistance. The white supremacist National Partisan Movement [[Telegram (software)|Telegram]] channel posted a memorial image with the text “Rest in White Power.” Some antisemitic groups now consider Babbitt a “representative of 200 million White Americans” who “struggle against Jewry.” They invoke the “memory” of Nazi Germany and ask others to “swear an oath to Ashli Babbit [sic] and all the martyrs of the past that you won't give up until we've at least surpassed the Germans in terms of struggle and sacrifice.”<ref>{{Cite web|title=Far-Right Extremists Memorialize “Martyr” Ashli Babbitt|url=https://www.adl.org/blog/far-right-extremists-memorialize-martyr-ashli-babbitt|access-date=2021-01-20|website=Anti-Defamation League|language=en}}</ref>
=== Calls for Violence ===

A "Million Martyr March," in Babbitt's honor, and other calls to violence were proliferated prior to Inauguration Day. One viral [[Parler]] post from a popular [[QAnon]] supporter announced “Many of Us will return on January 19, 2021, carrying Our weapons, in support of Our nation's resolve, to which [sic] the world will never forget!!! We will come in numbers that no standing army or police agency can match.”<ref>{{Cite web|title=Furious Extremists Call for More Violence Around Inauguration Day|url=https://www.adl.org/blog/furious-extremists-call-for-more-violence-around-inauguration-day|access-date=2021-01-20|website=Anti-Defamation League|language=en}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack

=== Portrayal of Ashli Babbitt as Martyr ===

According the the [[Anti-Defamation League|ADL]], Babbitt’s likeness has been used to create images, posts and other content celebrating right-wing extremist ideologies, including a flag commemorating the Capitol insurgency. White supremacists see Babbitt as a symbol of white resistance. The [[Anti-Defamation League|ADL]] reported that A "Million Martyr March," in Babbitt's honor, and other calls to violence were proliferated prior to Inauguration Day. One viral [[Parler]] post from a popular [[QAnon]] supporter announced “Many of Us will return on January 19, 2021, carrying Our weapons, in support of Our nation's resolve, to which [sic] the world will never forget!!! We will come in numbers that no standing army or police agency can match.”<ref>{{Cite web|title=Furious Extremists Call for More Violence Around Inauguration Day|url=https://www.adl.org/blog/furious-extremists-call-for-more-violence-around-inauguration-day|access-date=2021-01-20|website=Anti-Defamation League|language=en}}</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: ====January 24====

In a court filing, federal prosecutors asserted that evidence showed Erik Munchel of Nashville engaged in  “obstructing Congress, interstate travel in furtherance of rioting activity, sedition and other offenses.” Munchel had been photographed in the Senate gallery with white plastic handcuffs and a Taser. Federal judge [[Beryl Howell]] reversed a previous lower court decision that granted Munchel conditional release and ordered him to be transferred to Washington for further hearings.<ref>https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/legal-issues/tennessee-man-with-zip-ties-at-capitol-could-face-charges-of-sedition-other-felonies-after-riot-prosecutors-say/2021/01/24/d9c3cc58-5e83-11eb-9430-e7c77b5b0297_story.html</ref>

title: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: In a court filing, federal prosecutors asserted that evidence showed Erik Munchel of Nashville engaged in  “obstructing Congress, interstate travel in furtherance of rioting activity, sedition and other offenses.” Munchel had been photographed in the Senate gallery with white plastic handcuffs and a Taser. Federal judge [[Beryl Howell]] reversed a previous lower court decision that granted Munchel conditional release and ordered him to be transferred to Washington for further hearings.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/legal-issues/tennessee-man-with-zip-ties-at-capitol-could-face-charges-of-sedition-other-felonies-after-riot-prosecutors-say/2021/01/24/d9c3cc58-5e83-11eb-9430-e7c77b5b0297_story.html|title=Tennessee man with zip ties at Capitol could face charges of sedition, other felonies after riot, prosecutors say|first=Spencer S.|last=Hsu|via=www.washingtonpost.com}}</ref>

Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack

Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack
added: #Jason Schmid, Senior GOP aide on the House Armed Services Committee

<ref>{{cite news | publisher = politico.com | date = January 12, 2021 | title = GOP aide resigns while lashing ‘congressional enablers of this mob’ | author = ANDREW DESIDERIO | url = https://www.politico.com/news/2021/01/12/gop-aide-resigns-after-capitol-riots-457867}}</ref>
Three members of the National Security copucil resigned prematurely.

#[[Robert C. O'Brien]] (R) Deputy National Security Adviser<ref>{{cite news | publisher = politico.com | date = January 6, 2021 | title = Deputy national security adviser resigns after Wednesday's chaos | author = DANIEL LIPPMAN, LARA SELIGMAN and MERIDITH MCGRAW | url = https://www.politico.com/news/2021/01/06/security-adviser-deputy-possible-resignation-455713}}</ref>
